trans-unit.source: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.
trans-unit.target: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.
trans-unit.target: Use this method in the Windows Store analytics API to get review data for a given date range and other optional filters.

trans-unit.source: This method returns the data in JSON format.
trans-unit.target: This method returns the data in JSON format.

trans-unit.source: To use this method, you need to the following:
trans-unit.target: To use this method, you need to the following:

trans-unit.source: Associate the Azure AD application that you will use to call this method with your Dev Center account.
trans-unit.target: Associate the Azure AD application that you will use to call this method with your Dev Center account.

trans-unit.source: Obtain an Azure AD access token for your application.
trans-unit.target: Obtain an Azure AD access token for your application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Access analytics data using Windows Store services](access-analytics-data-using-windows-store-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Access analytics data using Windows Store services](access-analytics-data-using-windows-store-services.md).

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD access token in the form **Bearer** <*token*>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD access token in the form **Bearer** <*token*>.

trans-unit.source: The product ID of the app for which you want to retrieve review data.
trans-unit.target: The product ID of the app for which you want to retrieve review data.

trans-unit.source: The product ID is embedded in the app's listing link that is available on the [App identity page](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148561) of the Dev Center dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The product ID is embedded in the app's listing link that is available on the [App identity page](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148561) of the Dev Center dashboard.

trans-unit.source: The start date in the date range of review data to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: The start date in the date range of review data to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: The default is the current date.
trans-unit.target: The default is the current date.

trans-unit.source: The end date in the date range of review data to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: The end date in the date range of review data to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: The default is the current date.
trans-unit.target: The default is the current date.

trans-unit.source: The number of rows of data to return in the request.
trans-unit.target: The number of rows of data to return in the request.

trans-unit.source: The maximum value and the default value if not specified is 10000.
trans-unit.target: The maximum value and the default value if not specified is 10000.

trans-unit.source: If there are more rows in the query, the response body includes a next link that you can use to request the next page of data.
trans-unit.target: If there are more rows in the query, the response body includes a next link that you can use to request the next page of data.

trans-unit.source: The number of rows to skip in the query.
trans-unit.target: The number of rows to skip in the query.

trans-unit.source: Use this parameter to page through large data sets.
trans-unit.target: Use this parameter to page through large data sets.

trans-unit.source: For example, top=10000 and skip=0 retrieves the first 10000 rows of data, top=10000 and skip=10000 retrieves the next 10000 rows of data, and so on.
trans-unit.target: For example, top=10000 and skip=0 retrieves the first 10000 rows of data, top=10000 and skip=10000 retrieves the next 10000 rows of data, and so on.

trans-unit.source: One or more statements that filter the rows in the response.
trans-unit.target: One or more statements that filter the rows in the response.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section below.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section below.

trans-unit.source: A statement that orders the result data values for each rating.
trans-unit.target: A statement that orders the result data values for each rating.

trans-unit.source: The field parameter can be one of the following strings:
trans-unit.target: The field parameter can be one of the following strings:

trans-unit.source: The order parameter is optional, and can be asc or desc to specify ascending or descending order for each field.
trans-unit.target: The order parameter is optional, and can be asc or desc to specify ascending or descending order for each field.

trans-unit.source: The *filter* parameter of the request body contains one or more statements that filter the rows in the response.
trans-unit.target: The *filter* parameter of the request body contains one or more statements that filter the rows in the response.

trans-unit.source: Each statement contains a field and value that are associated with the **eq** or **ne** operators, and some fields also support the **contains**, **gt**, **lt**, **ge**, and **le** operators.
trans-unit.target: Each statement contains a field and value that are associated with the **eq** or **ne** operators, and some fields also support the **contains**, **gt**, **lt**, **ge**, and **le** operators.

trans-unit.source: Statements can be combined using **and** or **or**.
trans-unit.target: Statements can be combined using **and** or **or**.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example *filter* string: *filter=contains(reviewText,'great') and contains(reviewText,'ads') and deviceRAM lt 2048 and market eq 'US'*
trans-unit.target: Here is an example *filter* string: *filter=contains(reviewText,'great') and contains(reviewText,'ads') and deviceRAM lt 2048 and market eq 'US'*

trans-unit.source: For a list of the supported fields and support operators for each field, see the following table.
trans-unit.target: For a list of the supported fields and support operators for each field, see the following table.

trans-unit.source: String values must be surrounded by single quotes in the *filter* parameter.
trans-unit.target: String values must be surrounded by single quotes in the *filter* parameter.

trans-unit.source: A string that contains the ISO 3166 country code of the device market.
trans-unit.target: A string that contains the ISO 3166 country code of the device market.

trans-unit.source: Specify true to filter for reviews that have been revised; otherwise false.
trans-unit.target: Specify true to filter for reviews that have been revised; otherwise false.

trans-unit.source: The version of the app package that was reviewed.
trans-unit.target: The version of the app package that was reviewed.

trans-unit.source: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.
trans-unit.target: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.

trans-unit.source: The device screen resolution in the format "width x height".
trans-unit.target: The device screen resolution in the format "width x height".

trans-unit.source: Specify true to filter for touch-enabled devices; otherwise false.
trans-unit.target: Specify true to filter for touch-enabled devices; otherwise false.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the review was marked helpful.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the review was marked helpful.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.

trans-unit.source: The text contents of the review.
trans-unit.target: The text contents of the review.

trans-unit.source: The text contents of the response.
trans-unit.target: The text contents of the response.

trans-unit.source: The date that the response was submitted.
trans-unit.target: The date that the response was submitted.

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le

trans-unit.source: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.
trans-unit.target: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.

trans-unit.source: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le
trans-unit.target: eq, ne, gt, lt, ge, le

trans-unit.source: The following examples demonstrate several requests for getting review data.
trans-unit.target: The following examples demonstrate several requests for getting review data.

trans-unit.source: Replace the *applicationId* value with the product ID for your app.
trans-unit.target: Replace the *applicationId* value with the product ID for your app.

trans-unit.source: An array of objects that contain review data.
trans-unit.target: An array of objects that contain review data.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the data in each object, see the [review values](#review-values) section below.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the data in each object, see the [review values](#review-values) section below.

trans-unit.source: If there are additional pages of data, this string contains a URI that you can use to request the next page of data.
trans-unit.target: If there are additional pages of data, this string contains a URI that you can use to request the next page of data.

trans-unit.source: For example, this value is returned if the **top** parameter of the request is set to 10000 but there are more than 10000 rows of acquisition data for the query.
trans-unit.target: For example, this value is returned if the **top** parameter of the request is set to 10000 but there are more than 10000 rows of acquisition data for the query.

trans-unit.source: The total number of rows in the data result for the query.
trans-unit.target: The total number of rows in the data result for the query.

trans-unit.source: Elements in the *Value* array contain the following values.
trans-unit.target: Elements in the *Value* array contain the following values.

trans-unit.source: The first date in the date range for the ratings data.
trans-unit.target: The first date in the date range for the ratings data.

trans-unit.source: If the request specified a single day, this value is that date.
trans-unit.target: If the request specified a single day, this value is that date.

trans-unit.source: If the request specified a week, month, or other date range, this value is the first date in that date range.
trans-unit.target: If the request specified a week, month, or other date range, this value is the first date in that date range.

trans-unit.source: The product ID of the app for which you are retrieving ratings data.
trans-unit.target: The product ID of the app for which you are retrieving ratings data.

trans-unit.source: The display name of the app.
trans-unit.target: The display name of the app.

trans-unit.source: The ISO 3166 country code of the market where the rating was submitted.
trans-unit.target: The ISO 3166 country code of the market where the rating was submitted.

trans-unit.source: The OS version on which the rating was submitted.
trans-unit.target: The OS version on which the rating was submitted.

trans-unit.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section above.
trans-unit.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section above.

trans-unit.source: The type of device on which the rating was submitted.
trans-unit.target: The type of device on which the rating was submitted.

trans-unit.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section above.
trans-unit.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section above.

trans-unit.source: The value **true** indicates that the review was revised; otherwise **false**.
trans-unit.target: The value **true** indicates that the review was revised; otherwise **false**.

trans-unit.source: The version of the app package that was reviewed.
trans-unit.target: The version of the app package that was reviewed.

trans-unit.source: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.
trans-unit.target: The type of device on which the app was reviewed.

trans-unit.source: For a list of the supported strings, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section above.
trans-unit.target: For a list of the supported strings, see the [filter fields](#filter-fields) section above.

trans-unit.source: The device screen resolution in the format "*width* x *height*".
trans-unit.target: The device screen resolution in the format "*width* x *height*".

trans-unit.source: The value **true** indicates that touch is enabled; otherwise **false**.
trans-unit.target: The value **true** indicates that touch is enabled; otherwise **false**.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the review was marked helpful.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the review was marked helpful.

trans-unit.source: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.
trans-unit.target: The number of times the review was marked not helpful.

trans-unit.source: The text contents of the review.
trans-unit.target: The text contents of the review.

trans-unit.source: The text contents of the response.
trans-unit.target: The text contents of the response.

trans-unit.source: The date a response was submitted.
trans-unit.target: The date a response was submitted.

trans-unit.source: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.
trans-unit.target: The capacity of the primary storage disk, in GB.
